title: The Beverly Hills Hotel logo 50s script
content:
Hi there,

Can anyone identify this font?  
I've been hunting high and low. Thanks in advance...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315001003im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bhh_5545.jpg)
author: khole

comments.content: This is probably custom, since it's a logo and the "e"'s are different. You might like the scripts in the [Charles Blumlein Collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315001003/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000194), especially [Miss Fitzpatrick](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315001003/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000186), [Miss Lankfort](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315001003/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000110), and [Mr. Rafkin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315001003/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000080).
Thanks for the suggestions, auricfuzz. All the scripts i've been looking at are a little too cursive or "swash-y". The search continues...

Well, I'll give two other suggestions, though I doubt they're much closer to what you're looking for: [Handsome](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315001003/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/handsome) and [Estilo Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315001003/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/estilo-script).

[House Indistries](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315001003/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=fontsbystyle&s=9) Ed Script, League Night & House Casual (all in the list in that link) are upright scripts with a fairly consistent line width, but none have the "reversed 3" e of your picture.
